title: Ticket #7734: Add docker command line tools to execute node docker image for dind
description: Add the docker command line tools to the execute node image so that we can run docker universe jobs within a condor pool inside kubernetes.
remarks:
2020-Jul-13 12:57:34 by matyas:
Do we want to add the command line tools to all exec node images or do want to make a new set of images for this purpose? Like "htcondor/exec-dind:8.9.8-el7" ?

2020-Sep-28 14:30:03 by gthain:
Let's add the docker cli to all the worker node images

2020-Sep-28 15:17:45 by matyas:
Looks like this change is in the 8.9.6 image and the 8.9.8 image on Docker Hub, but not the 8.9.7 image. Should we add this change to the 8.9.7 image, for consistency's sake?

Also note that this hasn't been tested on the backfill wns pods since they all use the 8.9.5 images. I suggest doing the following:

  1. Update the pods to use the current 8.9.7 images and make sure regular jobs work
  2. Build new 8.9.7 images and push them to the CHTC registry only
  3. Update the pods again to use the new images; run some vanilla and docker jobs on them
  4. Push these 8.9.7 images to docker hub

2020-Sep-29 09:06:01 by tim:
Isn't the current release 8.9.8? Is there a reason that we are avoiding it?

2020-Sep-29 09:58:48 by matyas:
Yes, there should be an "update pods to 8.9.8" step at the end (unless 8.9.9 is out by then).

Basically:

  • I want to change Fixed Version from v080909 to v080906 since it's already "in" 8.9.6.
  • That's misleading though since it's not in 8.9.7, so I want to put it in 8.9.7.
  • I want to test it first.
